11113.content:
Katara watched as Aang continued to breath inside the bedroom of the Fire Nation ship that their group had captured. She watched as each time he breathed in, as even in his sleeping form, he seemed to wince in pain. He could feel the burning tears begin to prickle her eyes, but she wiped them away, and began to heal the wound Aang had suffered just a day ago. It was a very ugly wound, and it would make an even more ugly scar, both on his back, and on his toe where the lightning entered and exited his body, but that bothered her little, what did bother he was the fact that she was there, she watched him fall, and she was useless. She should have attempted to stop Azula, saw her even, but at the moment she was completely enraptured by the powerful aura that Aang created, and watched in awe as he ascended into the air, power seeping for every part of his body. Then the unthinkable happened...

Katara shook her head, getting the memory away as she focused on healing the wound, and watched as Aang's face began to relax. At least now, she was of some help, but she would never forgive her inability to save Aang, and she would do anything in her power to save him. Oddly enough, when Aang began to relax, she felt relaxed as well, as if healing his body was helping her as well, but she shook the thought off and looked at the one porthole in the room that they kept closed just in case. It was late, she concluded, and she knew she had to get to bed soon, but watching Aang being so vulnerable was what kept her awake. She was at fault, and she was the one who was going to fix him up.

Determined, she continued to heal him, but soon, her eyes began to droop, and an almost unnatural sleepiness began to overcome her. Feeling dizzy, and more than confused, she shook her head, and put the water back into the pouch - she would have to replace it with the ocean water later, but for now...

She yawned, and leaned forward from her kneeling position next to Aang, content to sleep next to Aang for the moment. She didn't want to leave him, not if he had the chance to wake up...

At that, she fell asleep, and he head dropped forward.

111131.content:
"Hello?" Aang called out. He was lost, confused, nauseous, but worst of all, he was alone. He was floating in an abyss, a void of darkness, surrounding all around him. He looked around fearfully, "A- am I dead?" He finally wondered at last, as the darkness never let up. He prayed to the spirits that it was all a deception, and he was really fine, but nothing ever changed. He tried to remember back to what had happened, but it was all so fuzzy, it was so... His eyes widened, "Oh no... I did die."

At first he didn't know what to think. He figured death would be instant, but this... This was not what came to mind when the word instant was brought up. "No... No. No no no no!" He screamed out in the darkness, "I can't be dead! I failed the world once! What will people think of me this time?" He cried out, freely letting his tears fall, "I don't want to fail the world... my friends... Katara..." There was nothing in response, not even his past selves to save him. He began to weep, then, he truly was alone. Forever to be in this darkness that was death, but suddenly, he coughed violently, and at that moment he realized that up until this moment, he hadn't had to breathe, but now he was forced to, but the darkness around him seem lacking air. He coughed again, but each one lost him more air. So this was real death? He thought to himself, he cried as he realized that suffocation was going to be his last bit of consciousness, and soon nothing else would matter.

He was dying, again. Once was enough, the intensive pain he had felt before had to be enough, but no, he had to get the next worst possible death as well.

However, he was so absorbed in his self-pitying thoughts, that he failed to see the light appear. It was a small dot at first, and it was easy to miss in the vast darkness, but soon it was growing in size, the light penetrating all corners of the void. At this Aang's eyes widened as he watched the light begin to form some figure, and to his surprise, the figure of Katara appeared. She watched him for a little bit in shock, but soon she cried out, "Aang?!" She saw that his face was turning a horribly dark shade of blue, and she let out a scream as she reached over to him. When she touched him, Aang felt air come back into his lungs, and he coughed as he breathed in the sweet air.

"Katara?" He looked up at her, "I thought I died... Where did you come from?"

"I... I don't know." She admitted, looking around the place, "I was healing you once, and then this." She waved her hands around the room of light, the light that was all coming from her.

Aang cried as he took in the sight of her, "I thought I would never see you again." He confessed.

"I thought the same thing." She cried as she held him closer, "I used the spirit water to heal you, but even then you were slipping... I stayed near you since it happened a day ago."

The two held onto each other tightly, until finally they let go and looked around the place.

Aang could safely let go of her now, and breathe fine on his own, but he asked the obvious question, "Where are we?"

1111311.content:
"Aang."

Both children looked around, searching for the source of the voice, but all around them the now light filled void entered their vision. "H-Hello?" Katara called out, but it was a useless action, as right when she called, the room disappeared, and all around them a new landscape began to appear. They were in awe of it all, the ground beneath them became a big stone pedestal, and around beyond the pedestal was what looked like some sort of swampland. Trees sprang up to the sky, which had a strange yellow and orange tint to it. Strange balls of light floated around, and most amazing of all, there in front of the both of them was Avatar Roku, atop his flying dragon. The olden Avatar had an extremely relieved look on his face, which seemed almost out of place on him.

"Avatar Roku?" Aang gasped, he looked around the room, "The Spirit World?" He was at a loss of words.

"I'm in the spirit world?" Katara gasped, "I can't believe it!"

"I don't understand though, I don't remember coming here... I thought I had died."

"And that is what we needed to direly talk about young Avatar." Roku said, climbing off his dragon, "I will take a page out of the Earthbenders book with this Aang: The Spirits were not happy. With your most recent failure - death - they wanted to outcast you from where you belonged in the afterlife, namely here." He watched Aang look away dejectedly, "They unanimously decided to destroy you, deeming you unworthy of ever having the title of Avatar, and they wished to erase you permanently."

"Then why am I still here?" He asked quietly, unaware that Katara was at that moment the equivalent of a ticking time bomb."

"I have a theory," He said looking at Katara, "And it has everything to do with you."

Katara gave him a sharp look, "What did I do? I hope I didn't do anything to make the spirit angry at me as well!" She said, restraining herself from lashing out further.

"On the contrary Katara, no. They are amazed at what you've done, something that hasn't been thought possible. You brought back Aang, from his demise. Furthermore, you successfully entered the spirit world to do so. Something that has never been done in over a thousand years, young girl."

"What?" She said, speechless, her previous anger forgotten for the moment.

"I came to you Aang, to welcome you back. I was one of the few of your reincarnation cycle who stood up for you. I also came so Katara here could explain just what she did to come here."

"I, I don't know!" She cried out, "I healed Aang with-" She paused.

"Yes, what is it?"

"Could it be the spirit water? Master Pakku gave me some in the North Pole!"

Roku shook his head, "The water is powerful, but to bring back the dead? No, it was something more. I do have a theory, but if I am proven correct, then you may not like it."

"What could I possibly not like? I saved Aang."

"That is true, but the consequences of such an action are severe." He let out a sigh, "I think in order to bring him back, you have given him a piece of yourself."

"What?" She asked.

"A piece of your soul. It has happened a few times before, when a person loves another very much, and refuses to let them leave, they can imbue their soul into that person. Of course, it has to be done with spiritual energies, which I suspect is what the water was, a conduit for your love and soul to pass over and save Aang, allowing you to come in here to save him."

Katara was blushing like mad and sputtering, "A- As a brother!" She claimed hastily.

Roku raised an eyebrow at her quick denial of her true feelings, but sighed. He remembered the trials of young love, and if these two wanted to face the challenges that came with it, who was he to spoil it for them? He smiled lightly, "If you say so." He watched Aang look disappointed, and he tried to cover up a laugh with a cough.

"As I was saying," He began, regaining his composure, "This has severe consequences. If the one who dies doesn't wish to come back it will kill the person giving up a piece of their soul. Since Katara is here and well, we can say Aang didn't wish to die. Secondly, because of this," He actually smiled widely at this, eager to see their terror, "You are soul bonded to one another, forever to feel what each other feels, be together forever, and maybe more." He finish dramatically.

Roku got the show he was expecting. Katara looked wide eyed at the man, unable to complete a simple sentence, her mouth was moving, but no sounds were coming out. Aang meanwhile was blushing furiously, he looked at Katara, and again blushed. At that moment Katara collapsed in shock, and that is when Roku let out a roar of laughter, he watched as Aang gave him the oddest look, but the old man didn't care. Their reactions were priceless.

"D- Does that mean you were joking about the bond thing?" He asked in a tiny whisper.

"Oh, no. I was serious about that."

"There is something very important you two should know though," He looked gravely at both of them, Aang helping Katara back up as she still was in visible shock. "The bond does have a consequence - every other day, you will not be yourselves."

"What does that mean?" Aang asked, because Katara was still in too much shock.

Roku looked down at the two children. Their reactions so far had been utterly hilarious, but this time, he wasn't sure if they would be fine if they heard this part. He let out a sigh, better now than never he supposed. "I don't want you to die from shock Katara, so please refrain from doing so."

"I am not going to like this." She muttered.

"Well, better get out with it. If what I believe to be true is correct, then every other day you will be switching bodies."

Silence...

...

...

Roku glanced up at the terror struck face of the children.

"W-w-w-wha..." Aang tried to form words. Katara had again fell down, foam was coming from her mouth and it seemed her eyes were rolling around in her head.

Roku looked at her in concern, "I hope that's not a seizure."

Aang still was speechless, and it was obvious Katara was out of it as well, so Roku sat down and waited. His dragon came by and sat by Roku as well. Several hours passed in the spirit world, and Roku sighed, thankfully time passed slowly in this world. Another few hours, Aang was looking into outer space, and Katara finally was able to sit up. She took quick glances at Aang before blushing like mad and mumbling to herself again. Roku watched, his amusement was at its end. So he finally stood up, allowing his dragon to fly away. He watched the two kids, acting as if they were crazy, and boomed out, "There is a reason it happens."

They both gave him a look.

"It's because Katara's soul is what is keeping both of you alive now. Both fragments of her soul still want to be in her body, even if she is willingly giving it away to you Aang. There's no way to fix it I am afraid," He sighed, "Her soul will be in a constant rotation between your bodies." He looked at their gloomy faces, "Don't worry," He said trying to lighten the mood, "Since Aang's lifespan will be longer than yours naturally Katara, your soul is strengthened to match his powerful state, which also means your waterbending will be more powerful."

"When I am in my body." She pointed out.

"Ah yes, you'll both have to adapt to that." He admitted, "Aang will also have to teach you how to use all the elements too now, since in essence, you are also the Avatar now." He thought aloud, "I wonder though, does that mean she can bend all the elements in her own body as well?"

"I thought you knew all about this!" Aang shouted.

"Oh, no, it's all just a theory."

Both kids eyes twitched, "So it's all a joke right?"

"No, I didn't say that." Roku sighed, "The probability of me being right is pretty high."

"But not a hundred percent?" Katara asked.

"No..."

Katara didn't look at ease, but was holding onto that thread, "Ok, maybe I am having a bad dream..."

Aang looked hurt at her unwillingness to be with him, and it angered him, but he quashed it down, not wanting Katara to feel it if what the old Avatar in front of him was saying was true. He also was an air nomad, and letting things like that get to him was not what he was supposed to do.

Suddenly for Aang, the world began to dim, "What's going on."

"You're awakening." Roku said, and Katara looked happy.

"That's great Aang!" She said, "I am sitting next to you, so wake me up when you do."

Roku winced, but shrugged, he would let the kids have this adventure on their own. "With that, I will be going. Be careful you two, this is new territory for you both, as well as us spirits."

"We will keep that in mind Roku, thank you for helping me, and thank you for supporting me."

With that Aang dimmed out of the spirit world.

"I am so glad he is waking up," She sighed, temporarily forgetting what she was told, "I hope he wakes me up soon."

Roku coughed, "I doubt that will be possible, considering the body you're currently in is in a comatose."

Katara looked up at him, "Oh, you've got to be kidding me..."

11113111.content:
Aang awoke, and couldn't help but smile as he did so. He was given a second chance by the one he loved, even if she didn't return his affection, he knew it was there, and the knowledge took forefront in his head and he lifted his head up and cracked her neck. For some reason, it was really sore. Also, he began to notice a few strands of hair covering his face. "That's odd." He muttered, but immediately stopped, that voice... It definitely belonged to Katara. He sat up ridged, and looked around, and then in a moment that seemed to transcend time and space, he looked down at the body lying next to him. His own face was lying down in a peaceful sleep. "Oh spirits." Aang gasped, unable to complete the connection to what happened, even if he knew what had happened. He stood to his feet, and stumbled around a bit, not used to the new body, and attempted to move, but only succeeded in falling back down.

"This is not good." He decided, or was that she now? Aang chose not to think of it as he got back up and used the wall as support. Shakily he took one step, and then another, and a few more. Feeling more confident, he slowly pushed away from the wall, and held his arms out at his sides like she was a child playing airplane, or a more perfect analogy would be that he felt like he was on a tight rope. His balance was off, way off. His center of gravity was different now, he was a little taller, and in an unfamiliar body. Of course it was going to be tough for him, and for him to even come across the though of being in his loves body... He blushed furiously, and again pushed those thoughts away as he tried to get one of the basics of life down - walking. After that, he would concern himself with other things.

It took nearly an hour, and by the end of it he really wished that he was comatose again, maybe even facing the black void again... no. No, he would rather not face that again, that was terrifying. Deciding upon that, he looked back towards himself, or rather Katara, maybe. He shook his head, of course it was Katara, who else could it be? He reasoned with himself as he walked over to her. He then knelt down and looked over himself... er, her. As he looked on, foreign memories entered his mind, those of Katara's he decided instantly. He remembered how it felt like for Katara holding Aang, the sense of loss she had when he wouldn't wake up. He remembered Sokka telling Katara to prepare for the worse, he remembered Katara sitting in this very room for over ten hours taking care of him, and in all of those, he saw Katara's feelings for him.

Aang was confused. Katara liked him, so why didn't she admit it?

"Must be a girl thing." He decided aloud.

"Uh, you are a girl, aren't you?"

Sokka entered the room, looking a little concerned, "I am guessing you haven't gotten a lot a sleep. You are probably a little delusional." He reflexively held up his arms, expecting Aang to hit him. When nothing came but silence he looked up, "Uh, aren't you going to hit me?"

"Why would I do that?" Aang asked.

"Wow, you must really be losing a lot of sleep if that is your reaction."

Aang laughed, "Please, don't worry about me, I'll be fine."

Sokka watched as his sister rubbed the back of her head while laughing nervously, "Now you're copying Aang's mannerism?" Sokka couldn't help but raise an eyebrow, "Now you're REALLY concerning me."

"Uh," Aang thought fast, what would Katara say if she wanted to be alone with him? Well, actually, the better question was what would Katara say if she wanted to be alone, considering she never exactly asked to be alone with him before. He mood darkened, and he frowned slightly, "Sokka, you can't force me to go anywhere." He finally said, crossing his arms, "And, um, that is final!"

"I am only concerned for you Katara, you're acting really weird."

"Me? Weird? Since when? I am perfectly fine!" Aang said, doing his best not to do his nervous laugh again.

"Listen, you need to get away from Aang for a while, I think you're starting to break down." He said seriously, looking his sister straight in the eyes.

Aang looked straight into his eyes, and a thought occurred to him, should he tell Sokka?

111131112.content:
"I'm not having a breakdown." Aang whispered, looking down. Oh he wanted to tell Sokka so badly, he wanted someone else to know of the burden, but then again, that would bring needless stress to Sokka's life. Furthermore, he would be doing it without Katara's permission, and to him, that was unthinkable. He looked down to the ground, but stopped, trying to recall how Katara usually acts, and looked her brother in the eye instead.

"Are you sure?" Sokka said.

"I- I am." He said a little louder, with more confidence in his voice, "Sokka, thank you for worrying, but I need to deal with this on my own."

Sokka looked away and sighed, "if that is what you really believe Katara, then I won't force you to go away, but try to get some sleep."

"I all ready have." Aang said, putting a reassuring hand on Sokka's shoulder to squeeze, hoping to the spirits that it was not too out of character for Katara to be doing.

Sokka hugged his sister tightly, and then walked out of the room, leaving Aang alone once more. He looked around the room, and noted the Fire Nation insignia for the first time, and nearly had a heart attack, but his breathing calmed as memories of the Water Tribe Warriors took the ship over, along with Katara, Sokka, and Toph. It was a quick battle, ended only a few minutes after it began. Aang looked over the room and nodded, so they had stolen a Fire Nation ship, that is smart. He decided, and he again attempted to get used to his body for now.

The moment came when he began to think about his body, a girls body, he said to himself in his mind, and he blushed. He could feel a lot of differences, but how was he supposed to go to the bathroom like this? Or even run? He could barely walk right without tripping, but to run? He shuddered at the though, everyone would think Katara was going nuts if that happened, and Aang did not want that to happen. He refrained from feeling himself, even if his curiosity was bursting at the seams. That would be violating Katara, and there was no way he was going to do that to her. He then felt the hair, it was silky smooth, he figured she wouldn't mind too much if he only messed around with her hair, he decided and he held the ponytail in front of his face, and messed with the hair loopies as he liked to call them. Unfortunately, the loops came undone, "Oh crap!" He muttered, "I have no clue how to fix that."

He put the decidedly much more messier than before ponytail back behind his head before he messed it up too much more as well. He then sat down next to his old body and crossed his arms in his lap sitting up straight. He refused to move, he didn't want to cause any trouble for Katara in this body, and he didn't know what else to do.

Eventually his eyes began to droop, and he leaned forward.
